Sentence: Doc Homer remembers his (Homer) daughters, Codi and Hallie, when they were young
Hallie leaves Tucson, Arizona, where she (Hallie) was living with Codi and Carlo, for Nicaragua
Shortly thereafter, Codi also leaves Tucson, returning to her (Hallie) small rural hometown, Grace, to care for her (Hallie) ailing father and to teach high school biology
Codi and Hallie's mother died shortly after Hallie's birth
Her (Hallie) father, the town doctor, was aware of the situation, but Codi still does not know this
All this time, Codi and Hallie, who have always been extremely close, exchange letters
